landingPage.subHeader: Maximize the power of your assets and start earning yield with Backd's liquidity pools.

reactiveLiquidity.description: Create Actions to automate your liquidity to where it is needed most.

earnYield.description: Earn interest on liquidity via yield-farming strategies such as Curve and Convex.

feeShare.description: Receive part of the fees that are charged on actions.

deposit.description: Deposit funds into Backd liquidity pools and receive pool LP tokens.

earn.description: Earn compounded yield from strategy profits and protocol fees as LP tokens appreciate over the underlying tokens.

stake.description: Stake your pool LP tokens to receive Backd rewards.

claim.description: Unstake your LP tokens or claim your Backd rewards at any time.

deposit.description: Deposit funds into Backd liquidity pools and receive pool LP tokens.

register.description: Register Compound or Aave loans on-chain to receive collateral top-ups, and stake your pool LP tokens to earn Backd rewards.

protect.description: Earn compounded yield and protocol fees as the LP token appreciates, while keepers monitor your loan and transfer your capital to avoid liquidation.

claim.description: Unregister or update a position, withdraw LP tokens or claim Backd rewards at any time.

uniswap.description: Backd Keepers detect when the price has moved outside of your defined range and move the liquidity into Backd‚Äôs yield pools. Once the price is back within range, Keepers move your liquidity back into Uniswap.

limitOrders.description: Once a limit order can be filled, a Keeper can withdraw the required funds from yield pools and execute the trade on the AMM.

curveImbalance.description: Keepers can detect when LP pools become imbalanaced and remove liquidity for you on your behalf - saving you from substantial losses.

nfts.description: Create a limit order for an NFT with a specific set of rarity traits. Once the price drops within your desired amount, a purchase Action is executed and liquidity is removed from Backd‚Äôs yield pools.

propose.description: Actions can be added through the Backd DAO. Join the Backd community and propose a new action!

auditedBy.description: Led by security experts from ETH Zurich and trusted by 85+ blockchain companies and corporations.

getStarted.description: Deposit liquidity and start earning yield.

notFound.subHeader: Try one of the handy links below - or <0>get in touch</0> if you believe there is an issue.

introduction.paragraph1: Backd is an Ethereum based protocol designed to increase the capital efficiency of borrowing assets in DeFi. Unlike other DeFi protocols, Backd liquidity pools react to market conditions and users‚Äô needs. In other words, users can optimize their debt positions by depositing assets into Backd pools which are then automatically deployed to where they are the most efficient.
introduction.paragraph2: The Backd protocol solves the problem borrowers of over-collateralized loans in DeFi are faced with: the higher the amount of excess collateral posted, the higher the opportunity cost of not being able to earn interest on these funds elsewhere. At the same time, low collateral-to-debt ratios result in higher liquidation risk to the borrower. Hence, borrowers are left with the non-trivial and potentially very costly challenge of manually allocating deposits across protocols, optimizing for high interest and low liquidation risk.
introduction.paragraph3: A solution is offered by Backd, which introduces the concept of reactive liquidity, whereby deposits are automatically shifted between protocols depending on the state of over-collateralized loans and the profitability of yield generating opportunities. More specifically, a liquidity provider (LP) on Backd is able to register deposits as ‚Äúbackup collateral‚Äù. Thereby the deposited funds can earn interest through yield farming strategies until needed to increase the user‚Äôs collateral-to-debt ratio on different protocols during times of market volatility.

pools.paragraph1: Through the combination of collateral top-ups and yield-farming strategies, Backd enables novel multi-utility liquidity pools. This empowers borrowers to increase the capital efficiency of their positions while better managing liquidation risk. Backd achieves this through the administration of single-asset liquidity pools. Users who deposit funds into a pool (liquidity providers) receive Backd LP tokens which can be registered for collateral top-ups (liquidation protection) and staked to earn further rewards. Furthermore, as collateral top-ups occur, LPs receive a share of the collateral top-up fees, in addition to any net profits harvested from a pool‚Äôs strategy.
pools.paragraph2: Liquidity pools function in isolation from one another with each asset having its own pool.  Backd will launch with liquidity pools for DAI, USDC, and ETH. In order to ensure that a sufficient amount of the underlying asset is available for collateral top-ups, each pool maintains a required reserve ratio. This ratio defines the percentage of total pool assets which cannot be utilized by yield farming strategies and remain idle at all times. This allows the protocol to invariably execute collateral top-ups, while reducing the transaction cost of withdrawals (including top-ups).
pools.paragraph3: Liquidity pools on Backd differ in several ways from one another:

assets.description: Pools are single-asset pools. Furthermore, for Backd v1, there will be only one pool per asset to prevent liquidity fragmentation.

parameterization.description: Pools are very customizable. For instance, each pool has a required reserve ratio, which specifies the percentage of the backing funds that need to remain idle in the pool, i.e., funds which cannot be allocated to strategies but are reserved solely for the purpose of top-ups. Intuitively, a lower reserve ratio comes with higher expected earnings (as more funds are allocated to a strategy), at the cost of increased insolvency risk, i.e., insufficient funds available for top-up.  Furthermore, pools can differ in terms of fees charged on top-ups and strategy performance.

strategy.description: The yield farming strategy used by a pool may differ to the ones used by other pools.

topUps.paragraph1: All Backd LPs have the option to register their LP tokens as backup collateral. Top-up registration is personalized to the user by allowing individuals to select the parameters that best serve their borrow positions and risk tolerance. The parameters required to register a top-up position are:

parameters.protocol: Protocol (that the loan is on, e.g. Compound)
parameters.address: Ethereum address that should be topped up
parameters.threshold: Health factor threshold at which a top-up should occur
parameters.single: Top-up increments (the value of a single collateral top-up)
parameters.max: Maximum allocation (the total amount that may be topped up)

topUps.paragraph2: Once registered, the user will continue to earn yield on the registered funds until a collateral top-up is triggered. A collateral top-up refers to using funds to increase the collateral for a particular borrow position. When this occurs, liquidity is shifted from Backd to the respective protocol, the collateralization ratio of the topped up position increases, and in turn mitigates liquidation risk. Collateral top-up eligibility is determined by the health factor of registered positions and is reported by Backd keepers.

keepers.paragraph: Keepers are an integral part of Backd‚Äôs collateral top-up mechanism. A keeper is an off-chain bot that monitors Backd top-up registrations and reports eligible collateral top-ups to the Backd smart contract. The Backd smart contract handles users‚Äô funds and executes top-ups by injecting capital into registered collateral. Keepers collect a percentage of the generated top-up fee every time they report an eligible top-up. In addition to this, keepers are also distributed Backd rewards in proportion to the top-up value they have executed.  Anyone can operate an off-chain keeper bot for Backd.

farming.paragraph: Each Backd pool employs a yield farming strategy using external protocols. As yield is generated through a pool‚Äôs strategy and top-up fees, the pool‚Äôs LP token appreciates, distributing the earnings to the pool‚Äôs liquidity providers. Similar to collateral top-ups, yield farming strategies are subject to a performance fee, which is split between their creator (i.e. the strategist) and a reserve fund.

components.paragraph: The Backd protocol consists of several key components. Let‚Äôs briefly examine each of these in a bit more detail:

pools.decription: When LPs deposit funds on Backd, they have to chose a single-asset pool to deposit into. If an LP wants some (or all) of their deposits to be used as backup collateral on some other protocol, they can register their top-up positions via the pool‚Äôs registry. A liquidity pool maintains a running total of the deposits which are registered as backup collateral. A pool allocates deposits that are not registered as backup collateral, plus a proportion of the registered backup collateral to a pool-specific vault.

vaults.decription: Each liquidity pool has a vault, which handles all deposit and withdrawal interaction with a strategy. For backd v1, single strategy vaults are supported.  Vaults contain a target allocation factor, which specifies the ratio of Vault deposits that should be allocated to the associated strategy. Hence, a vault typically holds an amount of idle funds for reduced gas costs.

strategies.decription: A strategy contains logic for yield-farming using the funds allocated from the vault. The performance of a strategy is tracked by the depositing vault and allocations are rebalanced according to the vault parameters (e.g. debt limits). Profits can be harvested and any unrealized profits are compounded by the strategy. The protocol charges a performance fee on strategy profits. Part of this fee is paid to a strategy‚Äôs strategist in LP tokens. The remainder of the performance fee is directed to the Backd treasury.

handlers.decription: These are the contracts that contain the logic for performing a collateral top-up for a particular protocol, such as Aave.

keepers.decription: As on-chain monitoring is not feasible on Ethereum, Backd relies on off-chain keepers to report registered positions eligible for top-up. An open source out of the box Backd keeper implementation will made available prior launch. However, it is encouraged that operators of Backd keepers further improve upon the initial keeper version (or create their own).

governance.paragraph: Backd will rely on a decentralized governance scheme, which will be introduced after the protocol launch. The protocol offers a lot of room for parameterization, such as required reserve ratios for pools, strategy allocation weights, reserve requirement weights for vaults or LP and keeper fees. Furthermore, new pools, strategies and supported protocols can be added via governance.
governance.disclaimer: Disclaimer: a Backd governance token does not exist at this point, so please do not fall for scams.

pools.overview: Backd‚Äôs single-asset pools aggregate yield across strategies. After depositing an asset, register an action to automate your liquidity to where it is needed most.

tvl.tooltip: The market capitalization of total assets held in Backd liquidity pools (total value locked)

apy.tooltip: The average annual percent yield over a 30 day period

revenue.tooltip: The total value of fees generated by the Backd protocol

deposits.tooltip: The current value of your assets held in Backd liquidity pools

locked.tooltip: The current value of your assets locked in actions. Assets locked in actions still earn yield

rewards.tooltip: The current value of earned rewards that have yet to be claimed

pool.overview: Deposit {{asset}} to begin earning yield via the {{strategy}} strategy. Once you have deposited, you can make your liquidity reactive by creating an action.

tvl.tooltip: The market capitalization of assets held in the pool (total value locked)

apy.tooltip: The current annual percent yield earned by pool LPs

strategy.tooltip: The current protocol funds are allocated to for yield farming strategies

deposits.tooltip: The current value of your assets held in the pool

locked.tooltip: The current value of your assets locked in actions. Assets locked in actions still earn yield

rewards.tooltip: The current value of earned rewards that have yet to be claimed

input.labelDesktop: Enter an amount of {{asset}} to deposit
Enter an amount of {{asset}} to withdraw

protocol.label: Protocol
protocol.tooltip: The lending protocol on which the user is borrowing funds (currently compatible with Aave and Compound)

address.label: Address
address.tooltip: The address of the owner of the position to top-up (e.g. if Alice is the borrower on Aave that should be topped up then this would be Alice‚Äôs address)
address.unique: Max of one position per protocol and address

threshold.label: Threshold
threshold.tooltip: The health factor threshold a collateral top-up should occur at

single.label: Single Top-up
single.tooltip: Amount of a single top-up increment (e.g. top-up increments of 2,500 DAI)
single.lessThanMax: Must be less than max top-up

max.label: Max Top-up
max.tooltip: Maximum top-up amount (value of your liquidity allocated for top-ups)

confirmation.summaryEnd: drops below {{threshold}}, it will be topped up with {{single}} {{asset}} ({{singleUsd}}). This will be repeated each time the collateralization ratio drops below {{threshold}}, until a total of {{max}} {{asset}} ({{maxUsd}}) is topped up.

delete.body: Deleting this top-up position will remove automated collateral top-ups of {{asset}} on {{protocol}}. {{max}} {{asset}} will be unstaked and can be withdrawn after removing the position.

actions.overview: Use this screen to monitor your Actions. Actions are a set of predefined market triggers, that when occur, something is done on your behalf.
actions.propose: + Propose a new Action on Discord
